title: What's News --  World-Wide
text:
Biden unveiled a $2.3 trillion infrastructure plan centered on fixing roads and bridges, expanding broadband internet access and boosting funding for research and development, plus higher corporate taxes to pay for the package.

---

The Covid-19 vaccine from Pfizer and BioNTech safely protects children between the ages of 12 and 15, the firms said, results likely to lead to inoculations within that age group before this summer.

J&J said one batch of its Covid-19 vaccine didn't meet quality standards at a contract manufacturer and the doses weren't distributed.

---

Derek Chauvin defended his actions to a bystander after holding George Floyd to the ground with his knee for about nine minutes, according to video played at the former police officer's trial.

---

Russia has begun mobilizing troops along its border with Ukraine, presenting a fresh challenge to the U.S. and threatening to upend a cease-fire between Ukraine and pro-Russia fighters.

---

The White House decided not to renew a ban on H-1B and other work-based visas that were imposed last year in response to the pandemic.

---

The NCAA faced a barrage of skeptical questions by the Supreme Court as it sought to defend tight limits on the types of compensation college athletes can receive.

---

A shooting at a Southern California office building killed four people, including a child, police said.
